author: Get News
title: Woongjin Thinkbig’s ARpedia Wins ‘CES Innovation Award’ for the Third Consecutive Time, A Global Leading EduTech Solution Makes Its ‘Mark’
text:
Recent Quotes View Full List My Watchlist Create Watchlist Indicators Industrial Estimate Composite Estimate 500 Stocks Estimate Gold Crude Oil Markets Stocks ETFs Tools Overview News Currencies International Treasuries Woongjin Thinkbig’s ARpedia Wins ‘CES Innovation Award’ for the Third Consecutive Time, A Global Leading EduTech Solution Makes Its ‘Mark’ By: Get News January 05, 2024 at 16:52 PM EST - Recognized for excellence in augmented reality technology, apps, and device sets.
- To be showcased at the CES 2024 booth... with a new Disney product launch planned for the first half of the year.
Woongjin Thinkbig's ARpedia, a global edutech product, has won the 'CES 2024 Innovation Award', marking the first time a Korean educational company has achieved this honor three times in a row. Leading the global education market as a pioneering edutech solution, ARpedia has demonstrated its unique augmented reality technology and innovation.
ARpedia, developed by Woongjin Thinkbig, one of Korea's leading edutech companies, is an 'Interactive Book' that provides a three-dimensional reading experience by bringing characters and illustrations from books to life through augmented reality (AR) technology. In Korea, it's a popular series with over 6 million individual books sold. Internationally, it has proven its market potential with contracts to supply at least 80,000 sets annually in the Chinese-speaking region (China, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macau).
This achievement is largely attributed to the global recognition of ARpedia's unique technology and educational effectiveness. At CES 2024, ARpedia won the 'Mobile Devices and Accessories' innovation award, securing its third consecutive title. This particular win is noteworthy as it acknowledges the excellence of ARpedia in all aspects of its set, including augmented reality technology (CES 2023, AR/VR category), apps (CES 2022-2023, Mobile Apps category), and devices (CES 2024).
Woongjin Thinkbig plans to introduce ARpedia to business representatives and visitors from various countries at CES 2024. Attendees will have the opportunity to explore all series that comprise the ARpedia set and learn in detail about the products' features and usage.
Furthermore, Woongjin Thinkbig is set to launch a new reading series, 'Disney Interactive Reading', in the first half of this year, based on a licensing agreement with Walt Disney. The initial marketing strategy will focus on Asian countries, where there is high demand for English reading education.
Sam-rak Choi, the head of Woongjin Thinkbig's EduTech Research Institute, commented, "ARpedia is sought after by companies and educational industry representatives in 24 countries where it is currently exported. With various new products including Disney Interactive Reading slated for release this year, it is poised to establish itself as a global representative edutech product”.
▲ Introduction of ARpedia
ARpedia, an experiential reading product that provides a three-dimensional reading experience through augmented reality (AR) technology, was launched in Korea in 2019 under the 'Interactive Book' brand. Targeting the international market, the English version of 'ARpedia' has received much acclaim and several global awards, including being the first Korean educational company to win the 'CES Innovation Award' three times in a row. In 2022 alone, ARpedia won the 'Kid’s Judge BETT', 'Mom’s Choice Award', and 'Teacher’s Choice Award', proving its success with children, parents, and teachers alike. In July 2023, Woongjin Thinkbig signed a licensing agreement with global entertainment giant Walt Disney for the launch of the Disney series.

author: 汪浩
title: 这家医院为职工定制"减肥方案"
text:
首页/
城市/
新政/
经济/
社会/
文化/
体育+/
科教卫
如果胖了，单位会发出健康提醒，还帮你一起减重！
杭州日报讯 体检检出体重超标，减肥焦虑怎么办？工作单位会来温馨提醒，并帮你一起减！浙江省肿瘤医院的“帮减服务”，让不少医院职工不亦乐乎。
昨天，浙江省肿瘤医院2025年体重管理年活动正式启动，全院160多位职工热情高涨，积极参加。记者现场采访，揭开该院职工的“减肥密码”。
单位“帮瘦”7公斤，他受益良多
启动仪式上，王岩涛作为职工代表，自信满满地上台分享。作为一名核医学科医生，他因工作忙、饮食不规律导致体重超标。在单位体检中，他被检出脂肪肝相关指标偏高。
“体检结果出来没多久，单位就来建议我认真减肥了，提醒我把脂肪肝的指标降下来。”王岩涛笑着调侃，没想到这么快就被“精准定位”。
“医生更要起到健康带头作用，那就减吧！”王岩涛说，去年，他参加了医院减重营集训班，经过1个月运动和饮食干预，体重下降了 7公斤，脂肪肝指标好转，目前体重一直没有反弹。
王岩涛介绍，减重营整合了营养科、健身教练等多种资源，为减肥职工定制减肥计划，开展1—3个月“营养+运动”的科学干预：细致到一日三餐拍照打卡，指导饮食；每天1个小时多类型运动的带练、监督打卡。
“同事队友”的互相鼓励，也让王岩涛受益。减重营把参与者分成多个小组，进行“横向PK”，要求每天在群里分享减脂餐、打卡步数，互相提醒“别久坐”“少喝奶茶”。“同事间的互相监督、鼓励，让健康管理从‘单打独斗’变成了‘集体行动’，减得更有劲了！”王岩涛说。
保健部主任黄静介绍，医院已连续四年开展职工减重营，主要组织招募体质指数（BMI）≥28的职工参加，通过专业指导开展联合减重管理，减重期间还会定期进行健康监测，并进行减重激励。
为帮助职工管理体重，医院出了详细方案
据了解，开设减重营，只是浙江省肿瘤医院职工体重管理活动的其中一部分。上个月，医院保健部、工会详细制定了医院首部《职工体重管理系列活动方案》，为职工定制全流程、全方位的减重方案。
记者在《方案》中看到，在职工上一年的秋季体检结束后，医院保健部、工会就会第一时间抓取职工体检数据，选取部分超重或肥胖职工，进行问卷调查和面对面访谈，详细了解他们的减重需求。
精准定位减重人群后，医院将从科普教育、膳食管理、运动计划、门诊治疗等方面助力职工减重：开展系列健康主题讲座和减重指南解读，帮助职工了解体重管理核心知识；根据中国居民膳食指南，设计体重管理期营养食谱，在医院食堂设立“低热卡膳食窗口”，并优化食堂堂食种类及烹饪方法；全年逐月开展系列健身活动，组织午间走路团，邀请专业的健身教练和康复治疗师创编工间操，并成立健康指导员志愿团队指导职工健康运动等；每周还将开设营养科、内分泌代谢科、心内科、心理科等健康减重门诊，请相关专业的专家为职工提供免费咨询等。
保障职工健康，是为了更好地服务患者
近年来，浙江省肿瘤医院持续开展“三无三降”医路健康行动，降低体重超标率，只是该项行动中的“一降”。
“三无三降”医路健康行动中包括：一无，新生子女无畸形；二无，常见恶性肿瘤首诊无中晚期；三无，无新增心脏支架安装；一降，降低体重超标率；二降，降低“三高”发生率；三降，降低严重心理疾患发病率。
自2021年初，该院党委书记、工会主席程向东提出了“保障每一位职工健康”的设想，之后经多次讨论及优化，医院形成了开展“三无三降”医路健康行动的共识。
“从医院职工的体检数据来看，2024年职工超重和肥胖占比分别为20.98%和5.38%，是逐年增长的。需要进一步强化制度建设、巩固职工健康成果。”程向东表示，为此，医院将进一步深化职工“三无三降”医路健康行动，提升职工健康水平，更好地服务医疗工作，提升患者就医获得感。

author: Michal Roberts
title: How This JetBlue Airbus A321 Made A Huge Milestone
text:
After opening its first US manufacturing plant in Mobile Alabama
, Airbus
delivered its first A321 from the facility to JetBlue Airways
in April 2016. The $600 million project was announced in 2012 and the plant was inaugurated in late 2015.
JetBlue took the delivery of the first-ever US-produced Airbus, which still flies for the airline after over nine years. It is registered as N965JT and was reconfigured on delivery from having 190 economy seats to 200. John Leahy, Airbus COO, on the day of the delivery, said:
“The Airbus U.S. Manufacturing Facility has brought together all the best aspects of our other assembly lines around the world, and it shows how Airbus people work hand in hand with our partners to deliver great aircraft to our customers.”
As of today, the US Manufacturing Facility is one of four assembly and delivery points for the A320 family and one of two for the A220 worldwide.
More about the Airbus facility
The facility is an assembly and delivery site for Airbus, where all different parts of the aircraft are delivered and assembled. The European Aeronautic Defense and Space Company (EADS), selected Mobile in 2005 to be the location of the company’s US facility.
Key factors in selecting Mobile were proximity to a deep water port and large open space around the Mobile Aeroplex at Brookley. The primary goal at the beginning was to have a better position competing in military contacts. In 2008, Airbus aggressively bid on supplying the US Air Force
with Airbus A330
converted tankers (KC-45). However, the bid was finally lost.
Related
Where Is Airbus Based? Examining The Manufacturer's 5 Most Important Facilities
The European planemaker has a truly global presence.
However, interest in opening a US facility remained, and in June 2012, Airbus officially announced that the plan would come to fruition as an assembly line for the A320 family. The plan encompassed a $600 million factory at Brookley Aeroplex, which was eventually opened in September 2015.
John Leahy, Airbus’ COO, praised the execution of the project during the first delivery.
“Going from breaking ground on this facility three years ago to handing over the first Alabama-produced A321 today is an amazing accomplishment. It’s a testament to how well executed this project was and how strong the teamwork has been here in Mobile and throughout Airbus.”
The facility in the US is one of four in the world, working 24 hours in line with the adage “The Sun Never Sets on Airbus.” They are located in:
- Mobile, Alabama
- Hamburg, Germany
- Toulouse, France
- Tianjin, China
How it supports the local economy
The opening of the facility has not been indifferent to the local economy, with not only Airbus creating jobs themselves but also many other suppliers coming parallel to the region, boosting the market.
C. Jeffrey Knittel, Chairperson and CEO of Airbus Americas, said:
“When we announced our intent to build A320 Family aircraft in the United States and to locate that facility in Mobile, Alabama, we also stated our intent to be a good neighbour, to create jobs and opportunities, and to help strengthen the U.S. aerospace industry. Five years later, we have become a major economic driver in creating an aerospace hub on the Gulf Coast,”
Additionally, the manufacturer hires almost 90% of its employees from the Gulf Coast region, and around 30% of them are US military veterans
. With plans to expand and triple its production rate, Airbus is constructing even more assembly and painting plants that will strengthen its position in the sector.
Related
How Does Business Aviation Impact Local Economies?
Business aviation makes an unseen but significant impact on local economies.
With an objective to produce 75 aircraft monthly by 2027, the manufacturer has pledged to create 1,000 extra jobs that will facilitate the expansion.
“Our operations in Alabama play a significant role in the expansion of Airbus’ global industrial capacity.” Daryl Taylor, Senior Vice president of Commercial Aircraft Operations for Airbus in the US, said. "We look forward to seeing the positive impact that this growth will have on our region for many years to come.”
New plans include a new Delivery Center, hangar bays, a new final assembly line (FAL), and production floors. Construction will extend beyond the current year.
The expansion is being carried out by Brasfield & Gorrie construction firm, which is focusing on the 360,000-square-foot final assembly line for the Airbus A320 and most of the other significant structures. The company has been Airbus’s choice for construction projects since the inception of the facility in 2012. The program manager for the company, HPM, concluded that:
“Bright days are ahead for Airbus as they look forward to completing the FAL 320 program, which will double the size of the Airbus footprint in North America and catapult the industry to new heights.”
What aircraft are produced at the Airbus Mobile plant?
Since opening the facility in 2015, Airbus has delivered over 500 aircraft (as of August 2024), with 180 aircraft being completed in the first five years. The site was initially set up only to manufacture the A320 family. However, it was expanded in 2017 to facilitate the production of the smaller Airbus A220 .
The Mobile plant is the final assembly line for the A320 family, centered around deliveries to US-based airlines. The first aircraft produced was delivered to JetBlue in 2016, and the 500th to Delta Air Lines in 2024.
Most of the components are built in Europe and later make their way to the Port of Mobile on ships. The factory was the last to build the A320ceo, having delivered the last aircraft with a current engine option to Delta in 2021.
Related
Airbus A220: Where Will The Next Big Orders Come From?
Airbus A220 orders have slowed and will likely be net negative in 2024. Where will the next orders come from?
As of 2019, new A220 are also assembled in the facility, with the first airframe being delivered to Delta in 2020. The aircraft is also manufactured in Quebec, Canada
in a facility previously owned by Bombardier
, after the acquisition of the CSeries
program. The decision to open the assembly line in Alabama was primarily to avoid tariffs related to selling Canadian-manufactured aircraft to US airlines, which later turned out not to be an issue.
Where does Boeing manufacture its narrowbody aircraft?
Boeing has three notable manufacturing plants in the US:
- Everett Factory – Wide-body manufacturing facility
- South Carolina – 787 Dreamliner manufacturing facility
- Renton Factory – Narrowbody manufacturing facility
Renton can be considered a competing manufacturing facility for Airbus, as it is where the 737 MAX and 737 P-8
Poseidon military variant is produced.
[Related
](/boeing-build-locations/)
The plant, which covers 1,100,000 square feet and is located near Renton Municipal Airport, was opened in 1941 and serves many different aircraft models.
After the the 737 program was introduced in 1967, the aircraft became Boeing’s most popular model, with almost 11,000 sold as of 2022. Built aircraft are usually flown from the facility to the Seattle completion center, where final adjustments, such as interior and painting, are made.
At Boeing’s Renton Factory, the following models have been manufactured:
- B-29 Superfortress – Total of 1,119 built
- C-97 Stratofighter – Total of 943 built
- Boeing 707 – First one was produced in 1957, and many still remain in service, in tanker configuration. In total 865 airliners were built.
- Boeing 727 – Total of 1,832 built
- Boeing 737 – Primary product of the Renton Factory
- Boeing 757 – Last one was produced in 2004. In total, 1,049 were manufactured
Opening the manufacturing plant in Mobile, Alabama was a big moment for the American aviation industry. The first delivery of the [Airbus A321](/tag/airbus-a321/)
to JetBlue in 2016 not only solidified the European giant's presence in the US but also led to the creation of one of the biggest aviation centers in the Gulf area.
Angela Till, Deputy Secretary of the [Alabama Department of Commerce](https://www.madeinalabama.com/):
“Airbus’ ever-expanding footprint in Mobile has become the core of a rapidly growing aerospace cluster throughout the Gulf Coast. This continued growth is a big vote of confidence in the quality and caliber of its Alabama workforce,”
Thanks to its strategic location, the plant became a key point on the global aircraft manufacturing map, positively affecting the region's economic growth.
The facility not only created thousands of new jobs but also attracted other companies and investors, setting the foundations for continued growth.
“Mobile remains on track to become one of the largest aerospace manufacturing hubs in the world, and I look forward to seeing Airbus reach future milestones at its Alabama home,” Till highlighted.
Plans to triple the current production rates by 2027 and continuous investments in the infrastructure show that Airbus has a big vision for its US location. Innovations, developments, and rising demand strengthen manufacturers' position in the US market.
Expansions, such as the new A220 line, prove that the near future will bring more and more accomplishments, making Mobile a key strategic place for Airbus.

author: Germán González
title: Vuelve la 'carrera del plogging': correr mientras se recoge basura del bosque - El Periódico
text:
Cerrar ventana emergente No solo se trata de correr más que los otros para llegar antes. Se trata de hacerlo limpiando de basura el monte a tu paso. Eso es el 'plogging' una modalidad a medio camino entre el deporte y la concienciación ecológica que tiene su gran cita el próximo 16 de marzo en varios parajes de la comarca de Osona, cuando se celebra la Ultra Clean Marathon’24 .
Los participantes recorrerán 36 kilómetros caminando o 60 corriendo por senderos recogiendo residuos a su paso Se trata de la carrera de referencia del 'plogging' en Catalunya y este año alcanza su sexta edición mezclando deporte, naturaleza, sostenibilidad y solidaridad. La Ultra Clean Marathon 2024 está organizada por la Xarxa per a la Conservació de la Natura (XCN) y la Agència de Residus de Catalunya (ARC) y tiene el mismo recorrido que el año pasado con salida y llegada a Vic pasando por las Guilleries, Sau y otros parajes del río Ter.
Noticias relacionadas
Alerta ante el posible colapso de la gran corriente oceánica del Atlántico: qué significa y qué implicaciones podría tener Fumar influye de forma permanente en el sistema inmunitario: "Los daños persisten incluso después de dejarlo" Los organizadores de la Ultra Clean Marathon señalan que es una "carrera sostenible y solidaria con la naturaleza" que permite "conectar con la naturaleza" al limpiar residuos , lo que transforma "la pasión deportiva en acción concreta para la conservación de nuestro entorno".
Dos circuitos En la edición de este año existe una novedad para hacer la carrera más participativa. Los equipos podrán elegir entre un circuito corto de 36 kilómetros, en equipos de 2 a 6 integrantes que pueden ir andando o corriendo, y otro, para corredores más preparados, un recorrido de 60 km del ultratrail, en equipos de 2 a 12 personas y haciendo relevos cada 10 km.
Los organizadores señalan que el primer circuito también se puede hacer en tramos d e 10 kilómetros para participantes que quieren apoyar la conservación del medio ambiente, pero no están en condiciones físicas de correr tanto.
La condición imprescindible es realizarlo mientras recogen los residuos abandonados en los espacios naturales que van encontrando a su paso. Al final de la carrera se premia, entre otras clasificaciones, al equipo que más residuos haya recogido a lo largo del recorrido . Por el momento hay unos 30 equipos inscritos , aunque hay tiempo para hacerlo hasta el 1 de marzo.
636 kilos de basura Este año también hay un ranking de donaciones para incentivar la participación solidaria y la concienciación ambiental de los participantes. Los equipos que recauden más dinero para la causa ambiental que elijan serán premiados. Para participar en el circuito corto, los equipos deben dar un mínimo de 300 euros a uno de los proyectos que promueven las entidades ambientales que trabajan en Catalunya. Para los participantes del circuito largo la cantidad mínima es de 600 euros.
En la pasada edición, 27 equipos y 210 corredores retiraron de la naturaleza 636 kilos de residuos y se recaudaron 12.650 euros para 18 entidades ambientales de Catalunya.
Imagen de la Ultra Clean Marathon del año pasado / Ultra Clean Marathon
La carrera se organiza de forma sostenible con un plan de gestión ambiental siguiendo la 'Guía de buenas prácticas en la organización y celebración de carreras y marchas por montaña' de la Generalitat y la Diputación de Barcelona, como la ausencia de cintas de señalización en todo el recorrido (se sigue el recorrido a través de GPS), el uso de garrafas de agua, vasos reutilizables y alimentos ecológicos en los puntos de avituallamiento y los dorsales en tejido reciclado.
Equipos que repiten Entre los participantes hay equipos organizados por empresas, organismos, escuelas, clubs deportivos y asociaciones. R epiten algunos de ediciones anteriores como Peusa, distribuidora de energías renovables, los 4 equipos de las escuelas Vedruna, o los 2 del Club de Tenis Sabadell . También repite Nnormal, que presenta un equipo de la Fundación Killian Jornet, encabezado por su coordinadora de educación y madre del popular corredor de montaña, Núria Burgada, e integrado por miembros de la entidad Transpirenaica Social Solidaria, con la participación de personas en riesgo de exclusión social .
El equipo de embajadores UCM - Urbaser contará con la participación de personas de reconocido prestigio en el ámbito del running: Anna Comet, ganadora del MDS 2022; Xavi Marina, especialista en pruebas por etapas por todo el mundo; Marta Molist, ganadora del Ultra Pirineo 2023; Jesús Gellida, finisher del MDS; Gerard Morales (Blacky), campeón de España de Trail Running; Erika Núñez, ultra runner y profesora de Yoga; Arcadi Alibés, periodista deportivo de TV3 con 159 maratones en sus piernas; y el eco-aventurero Albert Bosch.
Una carrera con "valor doble" Isaac Peraire, director de la Agència de Residus de Catalunya, señaló que esta carrera sirve " como modelo para otros eventos deportivos, demostrando que es posible organizar competiciones de alta calidad mientras se prioriza el respeto por el medio ambiente ". Marc Traserra, técnico del Consejo Deportivo de Osona, ha explicado que “esta carrera tiene un valor doble", ya que haces deporte de forma "sostenible" y aportando "mucho valor al territorio".
Por su parte, Eduard Comerma, concejal de Actividad Física y Deportes del Ayuntamiento de Vic, ha señalado también en la presentación de esta prueba que la carrera "encaja perfectamente" con los valores del Consistorio como son "correr en equipo, de manera sostenible y donde lo importante es participar ”.
